newsitem.title: UK: UK picks Prism for two rail franchises.
newsitem.headline: UK picks Prism for two rail franchises.

text.p: The UK's Office of Passenger Rail Franchising (Opraf) said it had chosen Prism Rail Plc as preferred bidder for both the South Wales & West and Cardiff railway franchises.
Prism already has one of the 25 British train operating companies currently being privatised -- the LTS Rail suburban London franchise which it was awarded on May 9.
Prism was formed specifically to pursue the opportunities afforded by Britain's rail privatisation process.
If it successfully completes negotiation of franchise contracts for the two Welsh lines it will become the first private sector company to have three separate franchise lines.
Opraf said it expected a formal award announcement would be made soon giving further details of the deal.
These would normally include the lengths of the franchise periods, the levels of subsidy agreed over their lives and any undertakings on investment in services or rolling stock.
The two Welsh lines are set to become the 10th and 11th lines to be franchised from the 25 passenger train firms.
